title: Is it possible to add more than one site (an array of sites) to the Cookies and Site Data Exceptions? If yes, how?
content: Looking for a way to add about 50 sites to the list of exceptions Firefox->Preferences->Privacy & Security->Cookies and Site data [article on managing cookies and site data doesn't suggest it is possible.] Any help is much appreciated:)
creator: chandangupta7

title: Zůstává otevřených několik Firefoxů

title: Firefox tabs suddenly keep crashing on MacOs
content: I tried using troubleshoot mode and the crashes happened on there too. I uninstalled and reinstalled firefox, created a new account, removed and added my extensions back on, restarted my computer, and yet the issue keeps persisting. The browser doesn't prompt me to send in a crash report when this happens either, it's only the tabs not the browser itself that repeatedly crashes.
creator: alltimechlo

title: Trouble signing in to two websites I use, if I use Firefox 6.10
content:
I have used Firefox for many years, on a Windows 10 64 bit desktop with DuckDuckGo Search engine. Two websites I subscribe to will not let me use firefox to sign in using Firefox. However Microsoft Edge allows me to sign in. WHY do I have a problem using Firefox?

Do some of my settings need to be changed?

SDB

PS Also why is it so difficult finding the version # ? this used to be using the about option and I can't find that anymore.
creator: Threecat

title: Zoom in Outlook
content:
I just realized that I have been using Zoom Control in Firefox to control items in Outlook. The first thing I log into is Firefox, after that, I log into Outlook 2019 and I use Zoom for Outlook since I have both Taskbars available. Some of it works and some of it doesn't. For example, I cannot change the size of messages I receive and send out. I am not referring to the text size I'm referring to the whole page of Outlook. The Zoom will zoom in or out on other parts of the page in Outlook but not the message section.

If anyone understands this I would appreciate some help. I'm already working with MS Outlook on this as well.

Thanks Rhonda
creator: Rhonda_89

title: Settings No Longer Allows Me to Chose WHERE  TO FILE
content: This has become really annoying: when I go to settings -files and application it is locked to "Downloads" Folder. I want them to go to desktop and then decide what folder I want to put them in (if at all)!
creator: vacadoug

title: Factory Reset
content: I need to perform a factory reset of my PC. How do I preserve all my Foxfire bookmarks and passwords?
